Ukraine however says that this is not true and that it was the result of a Russian missile headed for Kharkiv that went awry. It comes just a day after Russia was condemned by the Council of Europe. Ukrainian President Zelensky said we also have a powerful response from the Council, which is the first international organization to designate the current regime in Russia as terrorist.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: It's very important that this is a political signal, a signal to all the states, members of the Council of Europe and all states of the world, that there is nothing to talk about with this terrorist group, which appropriated Russia and unleashed the most heinous war in Europe in 80 years.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: After seven months of occupation, this area in Kherson region has recently been liberated by Ukraine.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: Russia has been losing ground here in recent days.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: The Moscow-appointed chief of the area says that they will begin evacuating civilians from Kherson city as the fighting slowly approaches.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: But the Kremlin is not giving up without a fight.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: Strikes continue across the country, like here in Velika Kostromka in the south of Ukraine.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: In the latest round of attacks, an 11-year-old boy has died in hospital after being rescued from the rubble in the town of Mykolaiv.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: A report by the European Union's anti-fraud watchdog has found that the EU's border agency Frontex covered up illegal pushbacks of migrants from Greece into Turkey.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: The findings suggest top managers committed serious misconduct and other irregularities in hiding incidents, not investigating them or handling them incorrectly.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: The 120-page OLAF report that was made public on Thursday says these illegal pushbacks are a fundamental violation of the people's rights.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: For years, many NGOs have claimed massive human rights abuses on the EU's borders, especially during the last massive migrant wave created by the war in Syria.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: And some Frontex staff did speak out.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: Concerns were raised after one worker witnessed Greek authorities forcing migrants back onto a flimsy boat into Turkish waters.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: The report raises questions about how Frontex will continue to operate in Greece.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: their hospital jobs every day and the majority of these work in emergency rooms difficult working conditions poor organization long hours low pay a deadly mix of factors is overshadowing the attraction for this area of medicine which was much sought after in the past by young doctors seeking an exciting fast-paced role with unique learning opportunities. This year, like last year, saw almost 50% of positions in emergency medicine stay vacant, but many of those who fill these positions eventually decide to leave.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: In these conditions, the ER physicians will soon be a rare commodity.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: Forget ER or Grey's Anatomy.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: The stark reality of hospital emergency rooms in Italy contrasts sharply with the ones depicted on TV screens. Young ER doctors seem impatient to go elsewhere to other hospital wards, to other cities or even abroad. Wherever they feel they can get the respect, the desire as physician. Angela Mauro is a pediatrician who after four years of work in an emergency room in Naples, decided to move to Milan and to a different hospital unit.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: ANGELA MAURO, Paediatrician, Naples, Since I left the emergency room, my quality of life and work changed completely in terms of stress and satisfaction. Now I can actually study my patients, and that means treating and curing them in the best possible way.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: This is satisfying for physicians.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: One of the issues is people's perception of ERs and the absence of appropriate filtering for treatment. Nowadays people tend to go to ERs for a mild fever or other minor conditions.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: tend to go to ERs for a mild fever or other minor conditions.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: EOR should deal with actual emergencies, with life-threatening cases, patients with severe conditions that family doctors could not see.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: Unfortunately, this is one of the reasons of dissatisfaction in EOR physicians.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: Along with the pay issue, there is the matter of professional recognition and a problem exacerbated by Covid, work-life balance.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: Beyond each physician, there's a human being. And nowadays, we don't have that time. The time to be fathers, mothers, grandparents and friends.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: Working hours are not respected anymore. We should work 38 hours per week, but according to our LES survey, we average 65 hours per week.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
